alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Karnes (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 07 at 2:54PM CDT until April 07 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN ATASCOSA AND SOUTHWESTERN KARNES COUNTIES... At 254 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain has shifted to the east of the Flash Flood Warning area. However, additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible within the next hour if the rain band nearby pushes a little to the north. Flash flooding could be ongoing due to heavy rain the past few hours. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Karnes City, Falls City, Coy City, Deweesville, Fashing, Hobson and Peggy. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
